intro: Cyclophorus africanus, commonly known as the African cyclophorus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its tubular, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has a compact, shrub-like growth habit with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
